awd_titl_txt: 1996 Gordon Research Conference on Photonuclear Reactions;   July 28-August 2, 1996; Tilton, NH
awd_abstract_narration: A conference will be held on the subject of the latest  developments in electron scattering and photonuclear  reactions.  This is a biennial meeting.  The topics include:  the spin and flavor structure of the nucleon, structure of  the delta resonance, the short-range structure of the  deuteron and few-body systems, tests of chiral perturbation  theory and low energy predictions of QCD, and short-range  correlations and nuclear medium effects.  All of these  topics are at the forefront of nuclear research, worldwide.  The meeting will permit researchers to compare techniques  and results which will in turn help them to plan their  future activities and produce the most insightful results.  The resources provided will allow very well qualified young  people to attend the meeting - researchers who would not  otherwise be able to attend.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
